p3_Package

Class ArrayClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • p3_Package.ArrayClass

  • public class ArrayClass
extends java.lang.Object
    Description: Class wrapper for a Java array, with additional management operations

    Note: Maintains a capacity value for maximum number of items that can be stored, and a size value for the number of valid or viable data items in the array

    Note: Contains a quick sorting method and a merge sorting method

    Author:
    Joshua Pollock

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int arrayCapacity 
      private int arraySize

      static int FAILED_ACCESS 
      private int[] localArray 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ArrayClass()
      Default constructor, initializes array to default capacity (10)
      ArrayClass(ArrayClass copied)
      Copy constructor, initializes array to size and capacity of copied array, then copies only the elements up to the given size
      ArrayClass(int capacity)
      Initializing constructor, initializes array to specified capacity
      ArrayClass(int capacity, int size, int fillValue)
      Initializing constructor, initializes array to specified capacity, size to specified value, then fills all elements with specified size value

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArrayClass

        public ArrayClass()
        Default constructor, initializes array to default capacity (10)

      • ArrayClass

        public ArrayClass(ArrayClass copied)
        Copy constructor, initializes array to size and capacity of copied array, then copies only the elements up to the given size
        Parameters:
        copied - ArrayClass object to be copied

      • ArrayClass

        public ArrayClass(int capacity)
        Initializing constructor, initializes array to specified capacity
        Parameters:
        capacity - maximum capacity specification for the array

      • ArrayClass

        public ArrayClass(int capacity,
                  int size,
                  int fillValue)
        Initializing constructor, initializes array to specified capacity, size to specified value, then fills all elements with specified size value
        Parameters:
        capacity - maximum capacity specification for the array
        size - sets the number of items to be filled in array, and sets the size of the ArrayClass object
        fillValue - value to be placed in all elements of initialized array up to the size

    • Method Detail

      • loadUniqueRandoms

        public boolean loadUniqueRandoms(int numRands,
                                 int lowLimit,
                                 int highLimit)
        Loads a specified number of unique random numbers in object

        Note: This method overwrites all data in the array up to the number of randoms requested

        Note: If requested number of randoms is greater than the array capacity, the array is resized

        Note: Size is set to number of random numbers requested

        Exceptional Condition: If more values are requested than are possible given the range of numbers, method returns false, otherwise, it returns true

        Parameters:
        numRands - number of random values requested
        lowLimit - lowest value to be generated
        highLimit - highest value to be generated
        Returns:
        Boolean true if method successful; false otherwise

      • isInArray

        public boolean isInArray(int testVal)
        Tests for value found in object array; returns true if value within array, false otherwise
        Parameters:
        testVal - value to be tested
        Returns:
        Boolean true if value is found in array, false otherwise

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Tests for size of array equal to capacity, no more values can be added
        Returns:
        Boolean result of test for full

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Tests for size of array equal to zero, no valid values stored in array
        Returns:
        Boolean result of test for empty

      • appendItem

        public boolean appendItem(int newValue)
        Appends item to end of array, if array is not full, e.g., no more values can be added
        Parameters:
        newValue - value to be appended to array
        Returns:
        Boolean success if appended, or failure if array was full

      • insertItemAt

        public boolean insertItemAt(int insertIndex,
                            int newValue)
        Description: Inserts item to array at specified index if array is not full, e.g., no more values can be added

        Note: Value is inserted at given index, all data from that index to the end of the array is shifted up by one

        Note: Value can be inserted after the last valid element but not at any index past that point

        Parameters:
        insertIndex - index of element into which value is to be inserted
        newValue - value to be inserted into array
        Returns:
        Boolean success if inserted, or failure if array was full

      • accessItemAt

        public int accessItemAt(int accessIndex)
        Accesses item in array at specified index if index within array size bounds
        Parameters:
        accessIndex - index of requested element value
        Returns:
        accessed value if successful, FAILED_ACCESS (-999999) if not

      • removeItemAt

        public int removeItemAt(int removeIndex)
        Description: Removes item from array at specified index if index within array size bounds

        Note: Each data item from the element immediately above the remove index to the end of the array is moved down by one element

        Parameters:
        removeIndex - index of element value to be removed
        Returns:
        removed value if successful, FAILED_ACCESS (-999999) if not

      • resize

        public boolean resize(int newCapacity)
        Description: Resets array capacity, copies current size and current size number of elements

        Exception: Method will not resize capacity below current array size, returns false if this is attempted, true otherwise

        Parameters:
        newCapacity - new capacity to be set; must be larger than current capacity
        Returns:
        Boolean condition of resize success or failure

      • runMergeSort

        public void runMergeSort()
        Data sorted using merge sort algorithm

        Note: Call runMergeSortHelper with lower and upper indices of array to be sorted

      • mergeSortHelper

        private void mergeSortHelper(int lowerIndex,
                             int higherIndex)
        Helper method for the merge sort algorithm

        Note: Call mergeSortHelper recursively with lowerIndex and middle indices

        Note: Call mergeSortHelper recursively with middle + 1 and higherIndex indices

        Note: Call mergeSort with lowerIndex, higherIndex, and middle indices of the array to be sorted

        Parameters:
        lowerIndex - lower index of the merge sort
        higherIndex - top index of the merge sort

      • mergeSort

        private void mergeSort(int lowerIndex,
                       int middleIndex,
                       int higherIndex)
        Sorting method for the merge sort algorithm
        Parameters:
        lowerIndex - lower index of the merge sort
        middleIndex - middle index of the array
        higherIndex - top index of the merge sort

      • runQuickSort

        public void runQuickSort()
        Data sorted using quick sort algorithm

        Note: Call runQuickSortHelper with lower and upper indices of array to be sorted

      • quickSortHelper

        private void quickSortHelper(int low,
                             int high)
        Helper and sorting method for the quick sort algorithm

        Note: Recursively calls quickSortHelper with low and calculated upper index

        Note: Recursively calls quickSortHelper with calculated lower index and high

        Parameters:
        high - the upper index passed through
        low - the lower index passed through

      • getCurrentSize

        public int getCurrentSize()
        Description: Gets current size of array

        Note: size of array indicates number of valid or viable values in the array

        Returns:
        size of array

      • getCurrentCapacity

        public int getCurrentCapacity()
        Description: Gets current capacity of array

        Note: capacity of array indicates number of values the array can hold

        Returns:
        capacity of array

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears array of all valid values by setting array size to zero, values remain in array but are not accessible

      • swapElements

        private void swapElements(int oneIndex,
                          int otherIndex)
        Takes in two indices and swaps their position in the array

        Note: Since this is a private method, no checks should be needed. This method WILL cause errors if used improperly

        Parameters:
        oneIndex - One index position to be swapped
        otherIndex - Another index position to be swapped
